intro: Polygala calcarea var. pyxophylla, commonly known as the sand polygala, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and distinctive, spiny capsules that contain its seeds. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. This species is often found in coastal dunes and is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils.
